fields.description:
h3. Summary
Reports showing years are showing the incorrect number of issues when drilling down into the data.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Data needs to be collected over many months to see the inconsistencies. 
# View a report showing past year by month
# Click on the number for the month to expand the details

h3. Expected Results
The number of issues for the month should for the calendar month. For example, February should return back all the results from February. If 5 issues are shown for February, 5 issues should be displayed.

h3. Actual Results
Issues from March are included in February on the drilled down data, instead of 5 issues being shown 9 are displayed.
 
h3. Notes
When using month this results in something like:
February 2017 is selected
Period calculated as March 2016 - February 2017
When calculating from this the start and end date for only February it uses the interval duration from first month, which is March.
The problem is that March has more days than February, so it comes up with a period overflowing into March.
The problem is even worse for January, as the code somehow calculated 1 December to 1 30 January as the period, since January has 31 days so it ends up in November before flattening that to the start of the month 

h3.Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: Report Drilldown calculating incorrect period by month

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-8405].
  {panel}
h3. Problem definition
Request type is always _No match_ if
* the issue has been created directly in JIRA
* the issue type has changed by editing this field (same workflow)
* the issue type has changed by moving the ticket (same project but different workflows)
* the ticket has been moved between different Service Desk projects

h3. Suggested solution
Automatically update the request type corresponding to its issue type

h3. Workaround
If the Move operation involves status changing, you can use the workaround below:
# The Request type _Heartware problem_ is associated with the Issue type _Problem_.
 !reqType.png|thumbnail! 
# Create an automation rule like the one below and include all existing request types and issue types. Whenever the status of any issue changed, if the issue type is not matching with the request type, set it accordingly.
 !rule.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Update Request Type automatically when issue is moved to different project or different workflow

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After editing color settings for _Highlights_ in Portal Settings -> View and customize the values of _Highlights_ and _Text on highlights_ are swapped after opening the portal for customization again.

h3. Environment
* JSD 3.3.0, 3.4.0, 3.4.1
* Safari 10

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk project
# Customize the portal look and feel from Project Settings -> Portal Settings -> View and customize
# Set _Highlights_ to a new value.
# Save the changes
# Close the window/tab
# Customize the portal look and feel from Project Settings -> Portal Settings -> View and customize

h3. Expected Results
The values for _Highlights_ and _Text on highlights_ will be the same as they were saved before.

h3. Actual Results
The values will be swapped and if you save they will be altered.
 
h3. Notes
You will not see this behaviour when after clicking save and then customize again in the portal.  You have to go back to Project Settings -> View and customize or reload the portal to see this issue.

h3.Workaround
Double check the color settings before saving.
fields.summary: Portal Settings - Highlight and Text on highlights values are swapped on subsequent edits

h3. Problem Definition
Many Service Desk environments often handle a variety of Asset/HR request via Service Desk. There is a lot of tedium in micromanaging these task. 

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have Automation in conjunction with the Approval process stream line the approval process. Similar to the functionality in [JIRA Checklist| https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.okapya.jira.checklist/server/overview]. That allows a checklist of subtask to be managed by the agents/managers and update the parent task to notify the customer.

h3. Why this is important
Currently there is a lot of overhead for the both user and the application (depending on the number of request) to accomplish this.
fields.summary: Allow subtask to be created via JSD automation and Approval.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-5025].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When moving an issue between Service Desk Projects, if the root Customer Request Type of the issue doesn't exist in the target project, the Customer Request Type will be set to "No Match" which will cause the issue to become invisible in the Customer Portal.
 Also, when searching for issues through JQL:
{code:java}
Customer Request Type is EMPTY{code}
The query will not result in issues that have been moved as they will issue still have the reference from the old request type in the database.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create two Service Desk projects
 # Set two different Request Types between the projects
 # In the Customer Portal, create an issue in the project A using a request type that doesn't exist in project B
 # Move the issue to the Project B.
 # The Customer Request Type of the issue will be set to "No Match" and the issue will no longer be visible through the Customer Portal

h3. !Screen Shot 2017-03-24 at 4.44.26 PM (1).png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

When moving an issue to the other project, it should have an option to select the new Customer Request Type which you want to set your issue, if the target project doesn't have a Request Type with the same name of the root project.
h3. Actual Results

The issue is moved without the Customer Request Type and with a reference from the old Customer Request Type from the root project in the database.
fields.summary: Request Type is set to "No Match" when moving issues between Service Desk Projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Click the My JIRA Home link (logo in the top left) does not always take a user back to the last Service Desk project they used.  Instead, it will take them to the last Service Desk project accessed with a full page load (typically selecting from the Projects drop down)

h3. Environment
* Service Desk installed
* User has My JIRA Home set to Service Desk
* User has access to multiple Service Desk projects

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open up Service Desk project A in a browser tab.
# Open up a second browser tab/window and go to Service Desk project B
# Close the tab/window with Service Desk project B open
# Interact with issues in the queue of Service Desk project A (transition issues, comment, assign, etc)
# Click the My JIRA Home link (logo top left)

h3. Expected Results
You are taken to the top queue in the list for Service Desk Project A.

h3. Actual Results
You are taken to the top queue in the list for Service Desk Project B

h3. Notes
It looks like the "last service desk project" is being set based on the page load and other interactions that are done via REST interactions in the queues do not update this value.  So it's possible to spend much of your day in a Service Desk project and then click the My JIRA Home link and be taken to a project you happened to have opened hours before. 

h3.Workaround
A few options:
* Work within one browser tab/window.
* Refresh the page after you switch back to a Service Desk project from another window/tab with Service Desk open.
fields.summary: My JIRA Home link does not always open the last project when set to Service Desk

fields.description:
h3. Summary

After updating SLA 'Pause On' condition, existing tickets with affected statuses are not updated.
h3. Environment

JIRA 7.3.2 
 JIRA Service Desk 3.3.2
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a service desk project with issue statuses _Waiting for Clarification_ and _Waiting for Call Center_.
 # Have an SLA with _Waiting for Clarification_ status in the *Pause On* conditions.
 # Edit the SLA *Pause On* conditions: *remove* _Waiting for Clarification_ and *add* _Waiting for Call Center_.

h3. Expected Results

After SLA recalculates:
 * The SLA is no longer paused for issues with the status _Waiting for Clarification_.
 * The SLA is now paused for issues with the status _Waiting for Call Center_.

h3. Actual Results

After SLA recalculates:
 * The SLA remains paused for existing issues with the status _Waiting for Clarification_.
 * The SLA is not paused for existing issues with the status _Waiting for Call Center_.
 * New issues and issues which are updated by the user see the SLA enter the proper state.
 * Only existing issues are affected.

h3. Workaround

Since any change/update to affected issues causes the SLA to enter the correct state for those issues, a bulk change to all affected issues (for example, bulk add comment) will update the SLA state to reflect the rule change.
h3. Notes

Locked reindex and JIRA restart have no effect on the SLA state. Screenshots attached.
fields.summary: Existing tickets do not respect new Pause On conditions

h5. Issue Summary

When an Admin schedules a maintenance window for the JIRA instance, there is no way they can announce this to all Service Desk customers or even have the announcement shown on the customer portal automatically for all projects.

h5. Steps to Reproduce

# Go to Announcement Banner page.
# Add a message to the announcement banner.
# Go to the customer portal

Similarly, adding an announcement to the Help Desk does not carry over to All projects.

h5. Expected Result

JIRA Service Desk would show a similar Announcement in each customer portal to match what is seen in JIRA.

h5. Actual Result

Nothing would be shown in the JIRA Service Desk, hence users would not know that the instance is down for maintenance or even be alert before the maintenance day comes.

h5. Feature Request

Either have the Announcement Banner map to all Customer portals or have announcements added to the Help Desk page mapped to all customer portals.

h5. Workaround

{panel:title=Option 1}
# Go to the Customer portal for each project.
# Add an Announcement to each letting the user know that there is a scheduled downtime.
{panel}

{panel:title=Option 2}
# Setup a URL redirect to listen for users attempting to access either JIRA or JIRA service desk customer portals, redirecting them to a page that contains a message that the site is down for maintenance.
{panel}
fields.summary: System Wide Announcement For Maintenance

h3. Summary

 Editing fields on edit issue screen will not work in software or business projects. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a software or business project
 # Add *Request Participants* to the edit issue screen.
 # Go to an issue from that project
 # Change any field. Eg: specify the sprint for the issue
 # Click update

h3. Expected Results

The edit screen will close and the sprint(or any field) will be updated to the issue
h3. Actual Results

The edit screen will be shown back(that is, it will not close) and the fields are not updated

Customer portal does not have web notification of ticket creation similar to getsupport.atlassian.com:

When an agent for example resolves or comments an issue, the customer receives an e-mail where the agent appears as the sender.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Help links within JSD 3.4 are referring to documentation links that do not yet exist on our site


h3. Environment
JIRA Service Desk 3.4.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a JSD project in 3.4, walk through the welcome guide
# 4th step of welcome guide an intro to queues
# Try to click the link for "Learn more about the power of queues"  https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/jsd-docs-034/Setting+up+queues+for+your+team

 !powerofqueues.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
A page is loaded in reference to documentation

h3. Actual Results
404 error
Not Found

The requested URL /jira/jsd-docs-034/Setting+up+queues+for+your+team was not found on this server.
fields.summary: Missing documentation for JSD 3.4

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4983].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
If an agent adds a customer directly to an Organization instead of adding them first as a Customer to the Project without them being part of an organization, they will be granted access to the Portal however they will not be listed in the Service Desk Customers project role. 

h3. Suggested Solution
List Organization members as part of the Service Desk Customers role. 

h3. Why this is important
Adding users as an Organization member but then configuring things to depend on being a member of the Service Desk Customers role will not work as expected. 

h3. Workaround 
Add the user as a customer (again), in the Customers page for the Project. They won't appear again, but they will be added to the Role as expected.
fields.summary: As a Service Desk Administrator I want to see Organization members listed in my Project's Users and Roles

Hello, 

Overnight our colour dashboard colour scheme changed (service desk, cloud). Tried to revert the changes via the "Look and Feel" section of JIRA Administration however these changes are not taking effect.

All of our Heading styles are also now missing.

JIRA won't let me raise this as a bug and Atlassian questions is broken / not loading at all. 
Please respond with resolution steps asap.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4978].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Currently there is no authentication failure notification / warning if the credentials are incorrect. 
h3. Environment

JIRA Server
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JSD project
 # Setup a custom email address under Email Requests Section
 # Change the password of the Email account setup in Step 2

h3. Expected Results

JIRA notifies the administrator that there is a authentication problem 
h3. Actual Results

No notification in JIRA UI in the Email Requests Section. 

This information can viewed in the Service Desk Mail Logs and it would be more useful if this was displayed in the Email Requests section in the Service Desk Project 
h3. Notes

JIRA logs will have a message like this 
{noformat}
2017-03-22 04:05:09.504876500 2017-03-22 04:05:09,504 Caesium-1-4 ERROR ServiceRunner     [c.a.m.incoming.jepp.puller] Messaging Error when MailPullerWorker pulls emails from xxxxx@xxxx.com : [AUTHENTICATIONFAILED] (#MBR1212) Incorrect username or password.{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Enter the correct credentials for the custom email account.
fields.summary: Authentication Failure Message for Incoming Mail Setup

h3. Problem Definition
Currently unable to hide Popular and Browse All from Customer Portal in Service Desk:
 !Screen Shot 2017-11-29 at 1.20.37 PM.png|thumbnail! 

Many users would like to hide this on their Customer Portal

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an option when editing Customer Portal to edit and hide certain sections.

h3. Why this is important
Better ability to change how Customer Portal displays depending on certain client's needs.
 
h3. Workaround 
No known workaround.

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
JIRA Service Desk 3.1.x introduced the Smart Portal and with it there was a dark feature to allow service desk admins to opt out of using it and revert to the older layout.

JIRA Service Desk 3.3.x appears to have removed this option for disabling the Smart Portal.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide some method by which the use of the Smart Portal can be avoided.
fields.summary: As a Service Desk admin I'd like to be able to disable the Smart Portal and revert to the older layout

fields.description:
h3. Step to reproduce the issue
# Create the application link between JSD and Conf with impersonation enable.
# Configure the KB connection on JSD
# Create a KB with a resolved ticket 
# Remove the impersonation on both Application link 
# Open the KB configuration or Issue view page

h3. Expected behaviour
There should be a warning on the KB configuration page about the modification and the defect. 

h3. Actual behaviour 
The configuration page shows everything is correct and on the JIRA issue view, it should that there is a space permission issue which is misleading on the actual issue.
fields.summary: No clear message shows that the impersonation is disabled on Application link

Is there a way I can increase the limit ( *more than 6 articles* to be displayed if they are matching) for the no of KB suggested articles that will show up whenever a user is submitting the request?

Thanks,

Swathi.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When commenting on an issue while assigning it to a user, the customer notification sent will contain the comment twice.

h3. Environment
* Service Desk 3.3.1
* SMTP email configured
* Reporter is a customer
* User assigned is a service desk agent
* Request type is set

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk Issue via the portal
# Ensure reporter is a customer
# Using a service desk agent, assign issue to a service desk agent using assign button
# Add a customer facing comment when performing the assignment
# Check email account associated with the customer account for the notification

h3. Expected Results
Customer notification should contain the comment only once, like any other customer facing comment:
{quote}
Service Desk Agent commented:

Assigning this issue to an agent to investigate.
{quote}

h3. Actual Results
Customer notification contains the comment twice:
{quote}
Service Desk Agent commented:

Assigning this issue to an agent to investigate.

----

Service Desk Agent commented:

Assigning this issue to an agent to investigate.
{quote}

h3.Workaround

Comment after doing the assignment so a normal customer notification is sent.
fields.summary: Duplicated comment in customer notification when commenting on assignment

fields.description:
h2. Problem Summary
When [QuickNav|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configuring-quick-navigation-175210673.html] is disabled on Confluence from the administrative UI, JIRA Service Desk will not be able to search for spaces for KB linking purposes. JSD does list 50 spaces in the dropdown for browsing, but if the intended KB space is not in the list of 50, the administrator will not be able to search or link to it. This is a problem for customers with moderate to large Confluence installations.

The reason this is being filed as a bug is because it is contrary to customer expectations. We either need to find a different way for JSD retrieve these spaces without relying on Confluence Quick Nav, or make it clear in product and/or documentation that Quick Navigation is required for the search to work.

h2. Steps to Reproduce
# On the Confluence side, go to Confluence Admin console > Further Configuration
# Click Edit and deselect the Quick Navigation checkbox, then Save
# On the JIRA side, go to a Service Desk administration page > Knowledge Base
# Try to search for a Confluence space

h2. Expected Behavior
The space appears in the search, auto-completing as the administrator types

h2. Actual Behavior
No space appears in the search, even if exact space name or key are inputted

h2. Additional technical notes for diagnosis
If using a browser's developer console during the KB space search, the following GET request will be issued:
{code}
https://jira.example.com/jira/rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/JSDKEY/kb/7846d0ab-681c-3fae-9102-c45968ac4464/space?query=C&_=1488484549051
{code}
And it will receive an HTTP 200 response, with the following:
{code}
{"statusMessage":"Quick nav disabled.","query":"SPACEKEY","contentNameMatches":[]}
{code}

h2. Workaround
Enable Quick Navigation for the duration of the JSD > KB setup.
fields.summary: JSD Cannot search for Confluence spaces for KB linking if QuickNav is disabled

  {panel}

h5. Issue Summary

When a user configures their Service Desk create request to contain a field help, the content of the help section will always appear on a single line failing to follow even HTML descriptions like the description section of fields found in JIRA.

h5. Usage Scenario

If a user want to let customer know what each option represents in an orderly manner, the ability to have each entry on a separate line would be great similar to the below:
{code}
Level 1 - For JIRA Outages, Critical Functions Broken.
Level 2 - For Major functions breaking or impacts a large number of people
Level 3 - Non-major functions breaking or impacts a small number of users
Level 4 - For learning about specific functions.
{code}

h5. Steps to Reproduce

# Go to {{Your Project > Project Settings > Request Type}} page.
# Select the Edit field link.
# In the page that comes up, add the field *Priority*.
# In the field help section, attempt to add a description with multiple lines.
#- On pressing {{Shift+enter}}, instead of creating a new line the parameter is saved.
# If you instead add an HTML script such as the below, it would still appear as a single line:
{code}
Level 1 - This is a Level 1 </br>
Level 2 - This is a Level 2 </br>
Level 3 - This is a Level 3 </br>
Level 4 - This is a Level 4 </br>
{code}

h5. Expected Result

Service Desk would obey the above and show the entries on multiple lines.

h5. Actual Result

JIRA Service Desk would show all entries on a single line as seen below(server result vs Service Desk result)

 !image-2017-03-20-17-49-10-891.png|thumbnail!  vs  !image-2017-03-20-17-49-50-533.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Allow HTML support for Field Help

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4954].
  {panel}

h5. Issue Summary

When a service desk agent closes an issue, if they are using a customized workflow or field configuration that does not make the resolution field compulsory, when the issue is closed, not customer satisfaction survey is sent as JIRA still considers the issue as being unresolved which is the condition required to be met for surveys as stated [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESKSERVER033/Collecting+customer+satisfaction+%28CSAT%29+feedback].

h5. Usage Scenario

In a company that does not mark issues based on resolution and only worry about transitioning the ticket to the closed status, there is no way for them to send out a custom survey for the customer to fill since JIRA would in all scenarios consider the issue as resolved.

h5. Feature Request

Allow JIRA Service Desk to recognize the *closed* state as a point to trigger the CSAT survey rather than just the Resolve issue.

This would help ensure that teams can have notifications sent to their customers once the the issue issue is closed.

h5. Existing

JIRA checks if the resolution field is field when the issue is closed and then triggers the notification.

h5. Workaround

Users can setup a generic resolution for their team when an issue has been resolved so that their issues would always be resolved to this generic resolution instead of having the field blank.
fields.summary: Allow CSAT to be Sent without Resolution

h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, if a Service Desk Agent wants to raise a Service Desk request for the Service Desk customer, the user will need to use *Raise a request* functionality so that all the Service Desk features for the request will work as expected. But this will add another step for the Agent to fill in all the Agent related information after raising the request. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Instead of using the fields that are configured for the Request Type in the Customer Portal view for the Customer, it would be good if the *Raise a request* feature actually picks up fields from the Create issue screen of the project. This also will avoid Service Desk Agent not to misuse JIRA Service Desk by creating Service Desk request via the normal Create button on the menu bar - which will end up breaking the Service Desk features for all the request.
fields.summary: Raise a request feature should include fields from the Create issue screen rather than the fields in the Customer Portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4947].
  {panel}

*Problem Definition*

User A1 and A2 belong to company A and are emailing user B1 from company B, with the JSD enable mailbox in Cc. If user A2 replies on the same email thread and removes B1 from his reply (i.e. just having a private company talk), the JSD email parser does not recognize this act and the message is still visible to B1. In other words, user B1 keeps being a participant of the issue even though we remove B1 from Cc field.

*Suggested Solution*

Make it possible for JSD to recognize when an email address is removed from an email thread and automatically remove the user from the issue.

*Why this is important*

Business users generally don't know the intricacies of a JSD enabled mailbox. They don't understand that email replies with the same subject get tagged together into the ticket.

It is normal business practice (at all companies) to split off an email discussion to an internal group and exclude the external customer from private info.
fields.summary: Email parsing when users have private conversations

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

After Service Desk 3.1 where there is no need for users to have a license in Confluence to be able to access the Confluence Knowledge Base through Service Desk, there's a few restrictions to accomplish that:
 # Have the same user base in both JSD & Confluence. You can accomplish this by using JIRA as a user directory for Confluence or by having JIRA Service Desk and Confluence use Crowd to share a user base.
 # Manually create a user in Confluence for every customer in JSD that will need access to the Knowledge Base. You can create a "customer" account in Confluence by not assigning it to a group. This will not count against your Confluence license.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add a specific permission on Confluence to allow Service Desk customers to search KB articles without a Confluence license.
h3. Why this is important

Since SDS can be fulfilled with new customers frequently, it can be a massive task to create customers account on the Confluence side just to provide them the ability to access KB articles through Service Desk
fields.summary: Allow SDS customers to search for Confluence's KB articles without the same user base

  {panel}

Recently, i've had a scenario where i have a group of users that want to be able to view any ticket creation they wish but to only receive notifications for business critical (severity 1) incidents raised

Our users currently receive 'all notifications' when an issue is created. I've had to set this in place as i have no other way to be able to filter out with a rule to select specific users to only receive a particular scenario of incident created

It work work for my situation if we could set up users to be in the same group as all users but to be able to set up an exclusion rule so they do not receive all notifications for issues created or updated

The reason for this request is because the users are part of a senior executive leadership team and whilst they want to be able to view a ticket as they see fit...they only want to be contacted via email notification when the problem is critical
fields.summary: User notification rules

fields.summary: Error when creating Service Desk request

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4929].
  {panel}

h3. Problem
Our workflow has many statuses that we display to the customer. Some are specific in that the ticket is waiting for the customer's response and our customers are currently having the most trouble location those tickets so being able to pull the tickets up by status would be helpful to us.

h3. Suggestion
Let customers be able to sort based on the status of the ticket on Customer Portal

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Let customers be able to sort based on the status of the ticket on Customer Portal
